title: VILLAGE / WASHERWOMAN
description: The Washing Woman who gives you access to the alternate sleeping location -- the shack. Includes fishing village mood and Evrart quest stuff.

dialogueTree.title: Washerwoman: "The old woman still sits in her cha..."
dialogueTree.english: The old woman still sits in her chair, continuing with her chores. As she does so, she quietly hums to herself.
dialogueTree.polish: Staruszka wciąż siedzi na swoim krześle i kontynuuje pracę, nucąc przy tym cicho.
dialogueTree.belarusian: Сталая жанчына ўсё яшчэ сядзіць на сваім крэсле і працягвае працу, ціхенька напяваючы.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "The buzz of electric lights blends..."
links.english: The buzz of electric lights blends together with the slow rumble of ocean waves at night.
links.polish: Brzęczenie elektrycznych świateł miesza się nocą z niskim szumem oceanicznych fal.
links.belarusian: Гудзенне электрычных ліхтароў уначы змешваецца з павольным грукатам акіянскіх хваль.

links.title: You: ""You're still up?""
links.english: "You're still up?"
links.polish: „Jeszcze pani nie śpi?”
links.belarusian: "Вы яшчэ не спіце?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Yes. I can't really sleep anymore...."
links.english: "Yes. I can't really sleep anymore. Only a few hours a night. It happens when you grow older..." She sloshes the water in the bucket around for a bit.
links.polish: „Tak. Właściwie to ja już nie sypiam. Ledwo kilka godzin dziennie. Tak to już jest, gdy się człowiek zestarzeje...” – stwierdza, po czym przez chwilę bełta wodę w wiadrze.
links.belarusian: "Так. Насамрэч, я ўжо амаль не магу спаць. Усяго пару гадзін на ноч. Так здараецца, калі старэеш...", — яна нейкі час плюхае вадой ў балеі.

links.title: Washerwoman: ""My suggestion is -- don't. Don't g..."
links.english: "My suggestion is -- don't. Don't grow any older than you already are. That's old enough." She smiles. "What's troubling your mind?"
links.polish: „Radzę, żeby pan tego nie robił. Niech się pan nie starzeje ani o dzień ponad swój obecny wiek. Jest pan wystarczająco stary” – uśmiecha się. „W czym mogę pomóc?”
links.belarusian: "Мая парада — не варта. Не варта рабіцца ні на дзень старэйшым, чым вы ўжо ёсць. Вы дастаткова стары", — яна ўсміхаецца. — "Што вас турбуе?"

links.title: You: "Don't bother her. [Leave.]"
links.english: Don't bother her. [Leave.]
links.polish: Nie przeszkadzaj jej. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: Не турбаваць яе. [Адысці.]

links.title: Washerwoman: "She keeps humming, nodding her head..."
links.english: She keeps humming, nodding her head back and forth to her unknown melody.
links.polish: Kontynuuje nucenie, kiwając głową w rytm nieznanej ci melodii.
links.belarusian: Яна працягвае напяваць, ківаючы галавой у так сваёй загадкавай мелодыі.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "There's a gap where the name of tha..."
links.english: There's a gap where the name of that song should be. You should ask her about it, right now!
links.polish: Masz dziurę w pamięci właśnie tam, gdzie powinien być tytuł tej piosenki. Powinieneś ją natychmiast o niego spytać!
links.belarusian: У цябе прабел ў памяці там, дзе мусіць быць назва гэтай песні. Табе трэба неадкладна пра яе спытаць!

dialogueTree.title: Washerwoman: "The woman next to a bucket of cloth..."
dialogueTree.english: The woman next to a bucket of clothes hums an odd melody. Her eyes are closed.
dialogueTree.polish: Kobieta przy wiadrze z ubraniami nuci dziwną melodię. Ma zamknięte oczy.
dialogueTree.belarusian: Жанчына каля балеі з адзеннем напявае дзіўную мелодыю. Яе вочы заплюшчаныя.

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Welcome to the fishing village." S..."
links.english: "Welcome to the fishing village." She opens her eyes. "Please lean in closer. I have cataracts."
links.polish: „Witam we wsi rybackiej” – odzywa się, otwierając oczy. „Podejdź bliżej. Mam katarakty”.
links.belarusian: "Вітаю ў рыбацкай вёсцы", — яна расплюшчвае вочы. — "Калі ласка, нахіліцеся бліжэй. У мяне катаракта".

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Then how does she know you're here?"
links.english: Then how does she know you're here?
links.polish: Skąd w takim razie wie, że tu jesteś?
links.belarusian: Адкуль тады яна ведае, што ты тут?

links.title: You: ""If you can't see, then how did you..."
links.english: "If you can't see, then how did you know I was here?"
links.polish: „Skąd pani wiedziała, że tu jestem, jeśli pani nie widzi?”
links.belarusian: "Калі вы не бачыце, то адкуль даведаліся, што я тут?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""I still have a golden ear. Come-co..."
links.english: "I still have a golden ear. Come-come." She beckons you toward her.
links.polish: „Wciąż mam świetny słuch. Bliżej, bliżej...” – przywołuje cię do siebie.
links.belarusian: "Я ўсё яшчэ маю выдатны слых. Хадзі-хадзі..." — яна заклікае цябе да сябе.

links.title: You: "Lean forward."
links.english: Lean forward.
links.polish: Nachyl się do przodu.
links.belarusian: Нахіліцца наперад.

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Oh." A shadow passes over her face..."
links.english: "Oh." A shadow passes over her face. "Welcome, police officer. We don't cause any trouble around here -- and we don't *want* any trouble either."
links.polish: „Och” – przez chwilę na jej twarzy pojawia się cień. „Witam, panie władzo. Nikt tu nie sprawia kłopotów – i nie *chcemy* tu żadnych kłopotów”.
links.belarusian: "Вох, — цень прабягае па яе твары. — Вітаю, спадар паліцыянт. Мы тут не ствараем ніякіх праблем — і таксама не *хочам* ніякіх праблем".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We're not here to cause any troubl..."
links.english: "We're not here to cause any trouble, madam."
links.polish: „Nie jesteśmy tu, aby sprawiać kłopoty, proszę pani”.
links.belarusian: "Мы тут не для таго, каб ствараць праблемы, спадарыня".

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "Trouble? Say the second thing, *bra..."
links.english: Trouble? Say the second thing, *bratan*! Shows you got style.
links.polish: Kłopoty? Zaprzecz jego słowom, *bratan*! Pokaż, że masz styl.
links.belarusian: Праблемы? Абвергні яго словы, *братан*! Пакажы свой стыль.

links.title: You: ""What he said. We're cops: We don't..."
links.english: "What he said. We're cops: We don't cause trouble, we take care of trouble."
links.polish: „Tak jak powiedział. Jesteśmy policjantami. Nie sprawiamy kłopotów, tylko je rozwiązujemy”.
links.belarusian: "Як ён і сказаў. Мы копы: мы не ствараем праблемы, мы іх вырашаем".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Oh, of course. Last time we saw yo..."
links.english: "Oh, of course. Last time we saw you around here was... twelve years ago. You also came to take care of trouble then. Which you *did*... but, still, in Martinaise you're considered an ill omen."
links.polish: „Och, oczywiście. Ostatni raz widziałam was tutaj... dwanaście lat temu. Wtedy też pojawiliście się, aby zająć się kłopotami. I *zajęliście* się... Ale i tak w Martinaise wasz widok uznawany jest za zły omen”.
links.belarusian: "О, вядома. Апошні раз мы бачылі вас тут... дванаццаць гадоў таму. Тады вы таксама з'явіліся, каб вырашыць праблемы. Што вы і *зрабілі*... Аднак ў Марцінэзе вас лічаць дрэнным прадвесцем".

links.title: You: ""Wait, I've been here before?""
links.english: "Wait, I've been here before?"
links.polish: „Zaraz, ja tu już kiedyś byłem?”
links.belarusian: "Пачакайце, я тут ужо быў?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""No, not you personally. I meant th..."
links.english: "No, not you personally. I meant the RCM. Some of the men got into a fight, one of them killed another. Locked himself in that woodshed over there," she points to the building behind her.
links.polish: „Nie, nie pan osobiście. Miałam na myśli MOR. Jacyś mężczyźni pokłócili się wtedy i jeden zabił drugiego. Zamknął się w tamtej szopie” – wskazuje stojący za nią budynek.
links.belarusian: "Не, не вы асабіста. Я мела на ўвазе РГМ. Некалькі мужчынаў пабіліся, і адзін забіў другога. Ён зачыніўся ў той адрыне", — яна паказвае на будынак ззаду яе.

links.title: Washerwoman: ""He was brooding, needed some help..."
links.english: "He was brooding, needed some help opening the door. You got it open for him and took him to think about what he'd done in a more secluded place. Somewhere more quiet."
links.polish: „Był pogrążony w ponurych myślach, potrzebował pomocy w otworzeniu drzwi. Otworzyliście je dla niego i zabraliście, aby mógł rozmyślać w bardziej odosobnionym miejscu. Gdzieś, gdzie jest ciszej”.
links.belarusian: "Ён маркоціўся, патрэбна было, каб нехта дапамог яму адчыніць дзверы. Вы адчынілі іх і забралі яго, каб ён мог падумаць пра тое, што зрабіў, у больш аддаленым месцы. Цішэйшым.".

links.title: Conceptualization: "She says it as if he was on some ki..."
links.english: She says it as if he was on some kind of spiritual retreat.
links.polish: Mówi to tak, jakby zabrano go do jakiejś duchowej pustelni.
links.belarusian: Яна кажа гэта так, быццам ён быў на нейкім духоўным рэтрыце.

links.title: You: ""What kind of an ill omen are we ta..."
links.english: "What kind of an ill omen are we talking about?"
links.polish: „O jakim złym omenie mowa?”
links.belarusian: "Пра якое дрэннае прадвесце ідзе гаворка?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Oh, the usual. Dark tidings. Black..."
links.english: "Oh, the usual. Dark tidings. Black hound."
links.polish: „Och, o takim jak zwykle. Mroczne wieści. Czarny ogar”.
links.belarusian: "Вой, звычайнае. Змрочныя весткі. Чорны ганчак".

links.title: Inland Empire: "That's you alright. A black hound l..."
links.english: That's you alright. A black hound licking your own heels.
links.polish: Tak, to ty. Czarny pies liżący sobie łapy.
links.belarusian: Так, гэта ты. Чорны ганчак, які ліжа свае лапы.

links.title: You: ""I *am* an ill omen, alright." (Pro..."
links.english: "I *am* an ill omen, alright." (Proceed.)
links.polish: „*Jestem* złym omenem, to się zgadza”. (Przejdź dalej).
links.belarusian: "Я *і ёсць* дрэннае прадвесце, выдатна". (Працягнуць.)

Alternate1.english: "I am *totally* an ill omen. It's exactly what I've been telling everyone. The end is here." (Proceed.)
Alternate1.polish: „Jestem *absolutnie* złym omenem. Dokładnie to powtarzam wszystkim wokół. Koniec nadchodzi”. (Przejdź dalej).
Alternate1.belarusian: "Я *дакладна* дрэннае прадвесце. Менавіта гэта я і казаў ўсім навокал. Канец набліжаецца". (Працягнуць.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're not. No one around here con..."
links.english: "You're not. No one around here considers us an *ill omen*. People would have told us."
links.polish: „Nie jesteś. Nikt tutaj nie uważa, że jesteś *złym omenem*. Ludzie by nam o tym powiedzieli”.
links.belarusian: "Няпраўда. Ніхто тут не лічыць, што вы *дрэннае прадвесце*. Людзі б нам пра гэта сказалі".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""You're still welcome here." She no..."
links.english: "You're still welcome here." She nods. "As long as men with guns aren't chasing you. And maybe even then, because that's the kind of fishing village we've built."
links.polish: „Mimo to jest pan tu mile widziany” – kiwa głową. „Tak długo, jak nie gonią pana ludzie z pistoletami. A może nawet wtedy, bo właśnie taką rybacką wieś tutaj stworzyliśmy”.
links.belarusian: "Але ўсё роўна вы тут жаданы госць", — яна ківае. — "Да таго часу, пакуль за вамі не гоняцца людзі з пісталетамі. А можа нават і тады, бо менавіта такую рыбацкую вёску мы тут стварылі".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""I'm sorry there's not a lot of roo..."
links.english: "I'm sorry there's not a lot of room to park your motor carriage. And not a lot of houses. Or a lot of people. My kids are long gone... searching for treasure. So are others'."
links.polish: „Przepraszam, że nie ma tu zbyt dużo miejsca na zaparkowanie pańskiego powozu motorowego. Ani zbyt dużo domów. Czy ludzi. Moich dzieci dawno już tu nie ma... Szukają skarbu. Tak jak pozostali”.
links.belarusian: "Прабачце, што тут няшмат месца для паркоўкі вашай машыны. І няшмат дамоў. І людзей. Мае дзеці даўно пайшлі... шукаць скарб. Як і астатнія".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Ah, look at me ramble on." She wav..."
links.english: "Ah, look at me ramble on." She waves her hand. "What brings you to us?"
links.polish: „Ech, znowu plotę bez ładu i składu” – stwierdza, machając ręką. „Co pana do nas sprowadza?”
links.belarusian: "Эх, во я разбалбаталася", — яна махае рукой. — "Што вас да нас прывяло?"

links.title: You: ""If I'm considered an ill omen, why..."
links.english: "If I'm considered an ill omen, why hasn't anyone told me that?" (Proceed.)
links.polish: „Jeśli jestem uważany za zły omen, to czemu nikt mi tego nie powiedział?” (Przejdź dalej).
links.belarusian: "Калі мяне лічаць дрэнным прадвесцем, чаму ніхто мне гэтага не сказаў?" (Працягнуць.)

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Maybe they're afraid.""
links.english: "Maybe they're afraid."
links.polish: „Może się boją”.
links.belarusian: "Можа, яны баяцца".

links.title: You: ""Why?""
links.english: "Why?"
links.polish: „Czemu?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Because you're an *ill omen*. But..."
links.english: "Because you're an *ill omen*. But you're still welcome here as long as men with guns aren't chasing you. And maybe even then, because that's the kind of fishing village we've built."
links.polish: „Bo jest pan *złym omenem*. Ale mimo to jest pan tu mile widziany – tak długo, jak nie gonią pana ludzie z pistoletami. A może nawet wtedy, bo właśnie taką rybacką wieś tutaj stworzyliśmy”.
links.belarusian: "Бо вы *дрэннае прадвесце*. Але ўсё роўна вы тут жаданы госць да таго часу, пакуль за вамі не гоняцца людзі з пісталетамі. А можа нават і тады, бо менавіта такую рыбацкую вёску мы тут стварылі".

links.title: You: ""I'm a cop, I don't cause trouble,..."
links.english: "I'm a cop, I don't cause trouble, I take care of trouble."
links.polish: „Jestem policjantem. Nie sprawiam kłopotów, tylko je rozwiązuję”.
links.belarusian: "Я коп, я не ствараю праблемы, я іх вырашаю".

links.title: You: ""We're cops. We're hellraisers. Cli..."
links.english: "We're cops. We're hellraisers. Click, click. Bang, bang!"
links.polish: „Jesteśmy policjantami. Rozpętujemy piekło! Klik, klik! Bum, bum!”
links.belarusian: "Мы копы. Мы баламуты. Клац, клац. Бах, бах!"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""No, you're not. I've seen you arou..."
links.english: "No, you're not. I've seen you around here before. Twelve years ago. You didn't raise any hell -- you were quite helpful, actually. But, still, in Martinaise you're considered an ill omen."
links.polish: „Nieprawda. Już tu was kiedyś wiedziałam. Dwanaście lat temu. Nie urządziliście żadnej rozwałki – byliście bardzo pomocni. Ale i tak w Martinaise jesteście uznawani za zły omen”.
links.belarusian: "Няпраўда. Я вас тут ўжо бачыла раней. Дванаццаць гадоў таму. Вы нічога не баламуцілі — насамрэч, вы былі вельмі дагодлівымі. Аднак ў Марцінэзе вас лічаць дрэнным прадвесцем".

links.title: You: ""We're cops. We're hellraisers. Cli..."
links.english: "We're cops. We're hellraisers. Click, click. Bang, bang!" (Point your finger pistols at her.)
links.polish: „Jesteśmy policjantami. Rozpętujemy piekło! Klik, klik! Bum, bum!” (Wyceluj w nią pistoletami z palców).
links.belarusian: "Мы копы. Мы баламуты. Клац, клац. Бах, бах!" (Накіраваць на яе пальцы-пісталеты.)

Alternate1.english: "I'm a cop, *hellraiser*. Click, click. Bang, bang!" (Point your finger pistols at her.)
Alternate1.polish: „Jestem policjantem. *Rozpętuję piekło*! Klik, klik! Bum, bum!” (Wyceluj w nią pistoletami z palców).
Alternate1.belarusian: "Я коп, *баламут*. Клац, клац. Бах, бах!" (Накіраваць на яе пальцы-пісталеты.).

links.title: You: ""Uh, what if I don't want to?""
links.english: "Uh, what if I don't want to?"
links.polish: „Khm. A jeśli nie chcę?”
links.belarusian: "Хм, а што, калі я не хачу?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Tut, tut. Don't be shy now. It's g..."
links.english: "Tut, tut. Don't be shy now. It's going to be alright."
links.polish: „No, no. Niech pan nie będzie nieśmiały. Wszystko będzie dobrze”.
links.belarusian: "Вой-вой. Не варта быць такім сціплым. Усё будзе добра".

links.title: You: ""Later." [Leave.]"
links.english: "Later." [Leave.]
links.polish: „Do zobaczenia później” [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: "Да пабачэння" [Адысці.]

links.title: Washerwoman: ""I won't be going anywhere." She si..."
links.english: "I won't be going anywhere." She side-eyes the bucket full of clothes.
links.polish: „Nigdzie się stąd nie wybieram” – stwierdza, zerkając kątem oka na wiadro pełne ubrań.
links.belarusian: "Я нікуды не збіраюся ісці", — яна кідае позірк на балею, поўную адзення.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "You're not sure about the melody, b..."
links.english: You're not sure about the melody, but it might be South Samaran, possibly Siigayan (also known as the Apricot Suzerainty).
links.polish: Nie jesteś pewien tej melodii, ale może być południowosamarska albo pochodzić z Siigayu (znanego jako Morelowe Lenno).
links.belarusian: Ты не ўпэўнены наконт мелодыі, але яна можа паходзіць з Паўднёвай Самары, імаверна, з Шыігая (вядомага як Абрыкосавая Рэспубліка).

dialogueTree.title: Washerwoman: ""Our tenant, the policeman. I hope..."
dialogueTree.english: "Our tenant, the policeman. I hope the waves don't keep you up at night. What can I help you with?"
dialogueTree.polish: „Nasz lokator – pan policjant. Mam nadzieję, że szum fal nie przeszkadzał panu w zasypianiu. W czym mogę panu pomóc?”
dialogueTree.belarusian: "Наш кватарант, паліцыянт. Спадзяюся, шум хваль не перашкаджаў вам заснуць. Чым магу вам дапамагчы?"

links.title: You: ""Can you confirm for my partner Kim..."
links.english: "Can you confirm for my partner Kim that no one listened to the radio recently?"
links.polish: „Może pani potwierdzić mojemu partnerowi, Kimowi, że nikt nie słuchał tu ostatnio radia?”
links.belarusian: "Можаце пацвердзіць майму напарніку, Кіму, што ніхто тут нядаўна не слухаў радыё?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""I told you before! No, there has b..."
links.english: "I told you before! No, there has been no listening to the radio. Not last week, not in the weeks before."
links.polish: „Przecież już mówiłam! Nikt tu nie słuchał radia. Ani w zeszłym tygodniu, ani tydzień wcześniej”.
links.belarusian: "Я ж ужо казала! Ніхто тут не слухаў радыё. Ні на мінулым тыдні, ні ў папярэднія тыдні".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hm..." The lieutenant furrows his..."
links.english: "Hm..." The lieutenant furrows his brow. He looks back to the children and sighs.
links.polish: „Hmm...” – porucznik marszczy czoło. Rzuca okiem na dzieci i wzdycha.
links.belarusian: "Хм..." — лейтэнант хмурыцца. Ён азіраецца на дзяцей і ўздыхае.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Let's just get it out of the way a..."
links.english: "Let's just get it out of the way as fast as we can. Contact dispatch from my Kineema and ask them to connect you to the station. Maybe they can shed some light on this."
links.polish: „Miejmy to jak najszybciej za sobą. Użyj radia w mojej kineemie, skontaktuj się z dystrybutornią i poproś o połączenie z tą stacją. Może ktoś od nich rzuci jakieś światło na tę sprawę”.
links.belarusian: "Давайце проста разбяромся з гэтым як мага хутчэй. Звяжыцеся з дыспетчарам з маёй Кінімы і папрасіце злучыць са станцыяй. Магчыма, яны змогуць праліць святло на гэтую справу".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Anything else, now?" The old woman..."
links.english: "Anything else, now?" The old woman frowns. Her wrinkles frown with her.
links.polish: „Coś jeszcze?” – kobieta marszczy brwi. Do brwi dołączają zmarszczki na jej twarzy.
links.belarusian: "Штосьці яшчэ?" — старая хмурыцца. Яе зморшчыны робяцца глыбейшымі.

links.title: You: ""Have you heard a radio on the coas..."
links.english: "Have you heard a radio on the coast in the last week or so?"
links.polish: „Słyszała pani w jakoś zeszłym tygodniu radio na wybrzeżu?”
links.belarusian: "Вы чулі радыё на ўзбярэжжы прыкладна на мінулым тыдні?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""A radio? Hah -- no, we play no rad..."
links.english: "A radio? Hah -- no, we play no radio here. There is one in the shack, but it's never used."
links.polish: „Radio? Hmm... Nie, używamy tutaj radia. Mam jedno w chacie, ale w ogóle go nie włączam”.
links.belarusian: "Радыё? Хм — не, мы тут не ўключаем радыё. У мяне ёсць адно ў хаціне, але ім ніколі не карыстаюцца".

links.title: You: ""Are you *sure* you didn't hear any..."
links.english: "Are you *sure* you didn't hear any radio playing?"
links.polish: „Jest pani *pewna*, że nie słyszała pani grającego radia?”
links.belarusian: "Вы *упэўнены*, што не чулі ўключанага радыё?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""These ears know every sound that b..."
links.english: "These ears know every sound that belongs to this coast. I would know if I heard anything different."
links.polish: „Te uszy znają wszystkie dźwięki wybrzeża. Zorientowałabym się, gdybym usłyszała cokolwiek innego”.
links.belarusian: "Мае вушы ведаюць кожны гук на гэтым ўзбярэжжы. Я б зразумела, калі б пачула нешта іншае".

links.title: You: ""Any idea how the twins could have..."
links.english: "Any idea how the twins could have heard Speedfreaks FM?"
links.polish: „Wie pani, jakim cudem bliźniacy mogli usłyszeć Naspeedowanych FM?”
links.belarusian: "Ёсць ідэі, якім чынам блізняты маглі пачуць Хуткарэзы FM?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Was that the nonsense they were sp..."
links.english: "Was that the nonsense they were spouting? Pah!" She shakes her head.
links.polish: „Więc to są te bzdury, które wygadywały? Ech!” – kręci głową.
links.belarusian: "Гэта тая лухта, якую яны малолі? Аёй!" — яна трасе галавой.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Olden days were golden days. Life's..."
links.english: Olden days were golden days. Life's lustre is lost on those who speed.
links.polish: Dawne dni to złote dni. Blask życia przygasa dla tych, którzy pędzą na złamanie karku.
links.belarusian: Старыя часы — залатыя часы. Бляск жыцця згублены для тых, хто імчыць наперад.

links.title: Washerwoman: ""No, I have no idea where they hear..."
links.english: "No, I have no idea where they heard it. They've been in earshot all week, and no radio."
links.polish: „Nie, nie mam pojęcia, gdzie to usłyszały. Przez cały tydzień znajdowały się w zasięgu mojego słuchu i nie słuchały radia”.
links.belarusian: "Не, не маю ўяўлення, дзе яны гэта пачулі. Увесь тыдзень яны былі ў межах майго слыху, і ніякага радыё".

links.title: You: ""That's useful information. Thanks.""
links.english: "That's useful information. Thanks."
links.polish: „To przydatna informacja. Dziękuję”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта карысная інфармацыя. Дзякуй".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""If you say it is," she says, shrug..."
links.english: "If you say it is," she says, shrugging.
links.polish: „Skoro tak pan uważa” – stwierdza, wzruszając ramionami.
links.belarusian: "Калі вы так кажаце", — гаворыць яна, паціскаючы плячыма.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "The lieutenant, elsewhere in Revach..."
links.english: The lieutenant, elsewhere in Revachol, runs a finger over the rough mesh of a stereo. He is deep in thought. He needs to be here for this.
links.polish: W innym miejscu w Revacholu porucznik przesuwa palcem po szorstkiej obudowie radia. Jest głęboko zamyślony. Musi tu być i słuchać.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант, недзе ў Рэвашолю, праводзіць пальцам па шурпатым корпусе радыё. Ён занураны ў думкі. Ён мусіць быць тут і слухаць.

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Is there anything else I can help..."
links.english: "Is there anything else I can help you with?"
links.polish: „Mogę w czymś jeszcze panu pomóc?”
links.belarusian: "Ці магу я яшчэ чымсьці дапамагчы вам?"

links.title: You: ""We good, Kim?""
links.english: "We good, Kim?"
links.polish: „Możemy, Kim?”
links.belarusian: "Парадак, Кім?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Let's just get it out of the way a..."
links.english: "Let's just get it out of the way as fast as we can. Contact dispatch from my Kineema and ask them to connect you to the station. Maybe they can shed some light on this."
links.polish: „Miejmy to jak najszybciej za sobą. Użyj radia w mojej kineemie, skontaktuj się z dystrybutornią i poproś o połączenie z tą stacją. Może ktoś od nich rzuci jakieś światło na tę sprawę”.
links.belarusian: "Давайце проста разбяромся з гэтым як мага хутчэй. Звяжыцеся з дыспетчарам з маёй Кінімы і папрасіце злучыць са станцыяй. Магчыма, яны змогуць праліць святло на гэтую справу".

links.title: You: ""Must be exciting for you, Kim. Cal..."
links.english: "Must be exciting for you, Kim. Calling the station you're *accidentally* tuned into."
links.polish: „To musi być dla ciebie ekscytujące, Kim. Dzwonić do stacji, którą *przypadkiem* masz nastawioną w radiu”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта мусіць быць захапляльна для цябе, Кім. Тэлефанаваць на станцыю, якую ты *выпадкова* злавіў".

Alternate1.polish: „Gotów na spotkanie ze swoimi bohaterami, Kim?”

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm ready when you are." He turns..."
links.english: "I'm ready when you are." He turns his face away, toward nothing in particular.
links.polish: „Jestem gotowy, możesz brać się do dzieła” – odwraca się, chociaż nie patrzy na nic konkretnego.
links.belarusian: "Я гатовы, калі вы гатовы," — ён адварочваецца ўбок, не гледзячы ні на што канкрэтнае.

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Anything else?" A cold breeze rush..."
links.english: "Anything else?" A cold breeze rushes by. The old woman smiles.
links.polish: „Coś jeszcze?” – pyta staruszka, uśmiechając się na zimnym wietrze.
links.belarusian: "Што-небудзь яшчэ?" Дзьме халодны вецер. Старая ўсміхаецца.

links.title: You: ""Thank you, Kim.""
links.english: "Thank you, Kim."
links.polish: „Dziękuję, Kim”.
links.belarusian: "Дзякуй, Кім".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm ready when you are." He turns..."
links.english: "I'm ready when you are." He turns to the old woman. "Thank you, ma'am."
links.polish: „Jestem gotowy, możesz brać się do dzieła” – stwierdza, po czym zwraca się do staruszki: „Dziękuję pani”.
links.belarusian: "Я гатовы, калі вы гатовы, — ён паварочваецца да старой жанчыны, — Дзякуй, спадарыня".

links.title: You: ""I got shot!""
links.english: "I got shot!"
links.polish: „Zostałem postrzelony!”
links.belarusian: "Мяне падстрэлілі!"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Aye, even *I* can see that. I told..."
links.english: "Aye, even *I* can see that. I told you not to bring your trouble with you, policeman. We've got troubles of our own here..."
links.polish: „Tak, nawet *ja* to widzę. Mówiłam, żeby nie przynosił pan tu ze sobą swoich kłopotów. My mamy tutaj swoje własne problemy...”
links.belarusian: "Аёй, нават *я* гэта бачу. Казала ж, каб вы не прыносілі сюды свае праблемы, афіцэру. У нас тут сваіх праблем хапае..."

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Though I suppose you took the wors..."
links.english: "Though I suppose you took the worst of it. Turns out you were your *own* ill omen." The woman chuckles to herself.
links.polish: „Ale najwyraźniej wziął pan na siebie ich najgorszą część. Wychodzi na to, że był pan swoim *własnym* złym omenem” – stwierdza staruszka, chichocząc.
links.belarusian: "Але мяркую, што вы ўзялі сабе найгоршыя з іх. Атрымліваецца, што вы былі сваім *уласным* дрэнным прадвесцем", — старая хіхікае сабе пад нос.

links.title: You: ""My partner got shot, too. He's sti..."
links.english: "My partner got shot, too. He's still in the hospital."
links.polish: „Mój partner też został postrzelony. Wciąż leży w szpitalu”.
links.belarusian: "Мой напарнік таксама быў паранены. Ён усё яшчэ ў бальніцы".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""What do you expect? Police officer..."
links.english: "What do you expect? Police officers get put into dangerous situations all the time. Sometimes they get shot. It's a rough trade you're in."
links.polish: „A czego się pan spodziewał? Policjanci często biorą udział w niebezpiecznych sytuacjach. Czasem ktoś ich postrzeli. Wybrał pan sobie ciężki fach”.
links.belarusian: "А чаго вы чакалі? Паліцыянты ўвесь час трапляюць у небяспечныя сітуацыі. Часам іх раняць. Цяжкі ў вас хлеб".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Still, I'm sorry to hear about you..."
links.english: "Still, I'm sorry to hear about your partner. He seemed to be a decent enough sort."
links.polish: „Mimo to przykro mi z powodu pańskiego partnera. Sprawiał wrażenie porządnego człowieka”.
links.belarusian: "Аднак, спачуваю наконт вашага напарніка. Ён здаваўся чалавекам досыць прыстойнага гатунку".

links.title: You: ""Guy was cramping my style. Every s..."
links.english: "Guy was cramping my style. Every superstar goes solo in the end."
links.polish: „Gość burzył mi styl. Każda supergwiazda zaczyna w końcu karierę solową”.
links.belarusian: "Хлопец абмяжоўваў мой стыль. Кожная суперзорка ўрэшце пачынае сольную кар'еру".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""What kind of foolishness is that?..."
links.english: "What kind of foolishness is that? A cop's got to have a partner. That's in your nature, however you may deny it."
links.polish: „Co to za bzdury? Gliniarz potrzebuje partnera. To pańska natura, czy pan tego chce, czy nie”.
links.belarusian: "Што за глупства? Копу патрэбны напарнік. Гэта ў вашай прыродзе, як бы вы таго ні адмаўлялі".

links.title: Suggestion: "Should you try *THE EXPRESSION* on..."
links.english: Should you try *THE EXPRESSION* on her?
links.polish: Może powinieneś wypróbować na niej swoją *minę*?
links.belarusian: Ці варта паспрабаваць на ёй *ВЫРАЗ*?

links.title: Volition: "Absolutely not."
links.english: Absolutely not.
links.polish: W żadnym razie.
links.belarusian: Ні ў якім разе.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "And risk fleshly contact with this..."
links.english: And risk fleshly contact with this old crone? Spare yourself!
links.polish: I zaryzykować kontakt fizyczny z tą starą wiedźmą? Daj spokój!
links.belarusian: І рызыкнуць плоцевым кантактам з гэтай старой каргой? Май літасць!

links.title: You: ""He was my half-brother.""
links.english: "He was my half-brother."
links.polish: „Był moim przyrodnim bratem”.
links.belarusian: "Ён быў маім зводным братам".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Losing a family member's tough," s..."
links.english: "Losing a family member's tough," she nods solemnly. "But we've all lost someone we're close to, some more than once."
links.polish: „Utrata członka rodziny jest bolesna” – kiwa głową z powagą. „Ale wszyscy straciliśmy kogoś bliskiego – niektórzy więcej niż raz”.
links.belarusian: "Страціць роднага балюча, — яна паважна ківае. — Але ўсе мы страцілі кагосьці блізкага, некаторыя больш за адзін раз".

links.title: Empathy: "You could follow up on that, but su..."
links.english: You could follow up on that, but suspect you're not going to pry much out of her.
links.polish: Mógłbyś kontynuować ten wątek, ale podejrzewasz, że nie wyciągniesz z niej zbyt wiele.
links.belarusian: Ты мог бы працягнуць гэтую тэму, але падазраеш, што не выцягнеш з яе шмат.

links.title: You: ""He was alright.""
links.english: "He was alright."
links.polish: „Był w porządku”.
links.belarusian: "Ён быў файны".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""That the best you can say about yo..."
links.english: "That the best you can say about your *partner*? Sounds like it wasn't working out."
links.polish: „Tylko tyle potrafi pan powiedzieć o swoim *partnerze*? Mam wrażenie, że się między wami nie układało”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта найлепшае, што вы можаце сказаць пра свайго *напарніка*? Гучыць, быццам у вас не вельмі складалася".

links.title: You: ""I'm sorry I couldn't warn him in t..."
links.english: "I'm sorry I couldn't warn him in time."
links.polish: „Przykro mi, że nie mogłem go ostrzec na czas”.
links.belarusian: "Шкада, што я не змог папярэдзіць яго своечасова".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""I warned you," she nods solemnly...."
links.english: "I warned you," she nods solemnly. "I warned you men with guns would be coming after you. They always are with your kind..." Her features soften.
links.polish: „Ostrzegałam pana” – kiwa głową z powagą. „Ostrzegałam, że przyjdą po pana ludzie z bronią. Oni zawsze dybią na ludzi takich jak pan...” – jej twarz łagodnieje.
links.belarusian: "Я вас папярэджвала, — яна паважна ківае. — Папярэджвала, што людзі са зброяй прыйдуць па вас. Яны заўсёды побач з такімі, як вы..." — яе твар змякчаецца.

links.title: Washerwoman: ""So be careful. And don't be a hero.""
links.english: "So be careful. And don't be a hero."
links.polish: „Więc proszę uważać. I nie zgrywać bohatera”.
links.belarusian: "Таму будзьце пільным. І не гуляйцеся ў героя".

links.title: You: ""He was a prig who wouldn't dance w..."
links.english: "He was a prig who wouldn't dance with me."
links.polish: „Był zarozumialcem i nie chciał ze mną tańczyć”.
links.belarusian: "Ён быў нудзілам, які не хацеў танчыць са мной".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Wouldn't *dance* with you? Is that..."
links.english: "Wouldn't *dance* with you? Is that what you look for in a partner?"
links.polish: „Nie chciał z panem *tańczyć*? Tego właśnie oczekuje pan od partnera?”
links.belarusian: "Не хацеў з вамі *танчыць*? Дык вы гэта шукаеце ў напарніку?"

links.title: Volition: "You did call him a monkey fucker. T..."
links.english: You did call him a monkey fucker. That had something to do with it.
links.polish: Nazwałeś go małpojebcą. To mogło mieć wpływ na jego decyzję.
links.belarusian: Ты назваў яго малпаёбам. Гэта магло паўплываць на яго рашэнне.

links.title: You: ""This is no time for jokes. Can't y..."
links.english: "This is no time for jokes. Can't you see I'm in pain?"
links.polish: „Nie czas na żarty. Nie widzi pani, że cierpię?”
links.belarusian: "Не час для жартаў. Вы не бачыце, што мне балюча?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""What do you expect? Police officer..."
links.english: "What do you expect? Police officers get put into dangerous situations all the time. Sometimes they get shot. It's a rough trade you're in."
links.polish: „A czego się pan spodziewał? Policjanci często biorą udział w niebezpiecznych sytuacjach. Czasem ktoś ich postrzeli. Wybrał pan sobie ciężki fach”.
links.belarusian: "А чаго вы чакалі? Паліцыянты ўвесь час трапляюць у небяспечныя сітуацыі. Часам іх раняць. Цяжкі ў вас хлеб".

links.title: You: ""I guess you were right. The men wi..."
links.english: "I guess you were right. The men with guns were coming for me after all."
links.polish: „Na to wygląda. Widać ci goście z bronią przyszli jednak po mnie”.
links.belarusian: "Мяркую, вы мелі рацыю. Людзі са зброяй усё ж прыйшлі па мяне".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""I'm not sure those were the last o..."
links.english: "I'm not sure those were the last of the men with guns, either." She nods. "There are always more coming for your kind, officer."
links.polish: „Nie jestem pewna, czy nie pojawią się kolejni” – stwierdza, kiwając głową. „Na takich jak pan, panie władzo, zawsze ktoś dybie”.
links.belarusian: "Я, аднак, не ўпэўнена, ці гэта былі апошнія з людзей са зброяй, — яна ківае. —  За такімі, як вы, афіцэру, заўсёды прыходзяць зноў".

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "Then we'll be *ready* for them."
links.english: Then we'll be *ready* for them.
links.polish: Więc będziemy na nich *gotowi*.
links.belarusian: Тады мы будзем да іх *гатовыя*.

links.title: You: ""Why was there a bullet under the f..."
links.english: "Why was there a bullet under the floorboards of your shack?"
links.polish: „Czemu pod podłogą pani chaty znajdował się nabój?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму пад падлогай вашай хаціны быў патрон?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""God damn that girl," she murmurs s..."
links.english: "God damn that girl," she murmurs softly.
links.polish: „Przeklęta dziewucha” – mamrocze do siebie cicho.
links.belarusian: "Клятая дзяўчына", — ціха мармыча яна.

links.title: Composure: "And without anger. A long and harsh..."
links.english: And without anger. A long and harsh life has taught her not to buckle under pressure.
links.polish: I bez złości. Długie i ciężkie życie nauczyło ją nie uginać się pod presją.
links.belarusian: І без злосці. Доўгае і цяжкае жыццё навучыла яе не згінацца пад ціскам.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A bullet?" The lieutenant turns to..."
links.english: "A bullet?" The lieutenant turns to you and gives you a little nod, then turns to the washerwoman:
links.polish: „Nabój?” – porucznik odwraca się do ciebie i kiwa lekko głową, po czym zwraca się do praczki:
links.belarusian: "Патрон?", — лейтэнант паварочваецца да цябе і злёгку ківае, пасля чаго звяртаецца да прачкі:

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You didn't put it there, did you?..."
links.english: "You didn't put it there, did you? *She* did."
links.polish: „To nie pani go tam włożyła, prawda? To *ona* to zrobiła”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта ж не вы яго туды паклалі, так? Гэта была *яна*".

links.title: You: ""I'm guessing you didn't put it the..."
links.english: "I'm guessing you didn't put it there -- Ruby did."
links.polish: „A więc zgaduję, że nie pani go tam umieściła, lecz Ruby”.
links.belarusian: "Мяркую, не вы яго туды паклалі — гэта была Рубі".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Gone and hid things in there..." S..."
links.english: "Gone and hid things in there..." She shakes her head. "She's usually a good tenant. And not a *stupid* one either."
links.polish: „Zniknęła i coś tam ukryła...” – kręci głową. „Zwykle jest dobrą lokatorką. I do tego *niegłupią*”.
links.belarusian: "Знікла і нешта там схавала... — яна круціць галавой. — Звычайна яна добрая кватарантка. І да таго ж не *дурная*".

links.title: You: ""You rented the room to her?""
links.english: "You rented the room to her?"
links.polish: „Wynajęła jej pani pokój?”
links.belarusian: "Вы здавалі ёй пакой?"

links.title: Washerwoman: "“Yes, I let my room to that Ruby gi..."
links.english: “Yes, I let my room to that Ruby girl…” She speaks slowly, wringing out a rag, after a long silence. Her hands move into the water bucket. Some water sloshes over the edge.
links.polish: „Tak, pozwoliłam zatrzymać się w nim tej Ruby...” – stwierdza wolno po dłuższej chwili milczenia, wykręcając szmatę. Jej dłonie wędrują do wiadra z wodą. Trochę wody wychlapuje się na ziemię.
links.belarusian: "Так, я здала пакой гэтай Рубі..." — кажа яна павольна пасля доўгага маўчання, выкручваючы анучку. Яе рукі рухаюцца да вядра з вадой. Трохі вады выплёскваецца праз край.

links.title: Washerwoman: ""As I've done before when she's bee..."
links.english: "As I've done before when she's been in trouble, or just looking for solitude. I've made it clear -- we welcome all kinds of people here."
links.polish: „Robiłam tak już wcześniej, gdy miała problemy albo po prostu potrzebowała samotności. Mówiłam już – przyjmujemy tu wszystkich”.
links.belarusian: "Як я рабіла раней, калі ў яе былі праблемы або яна проста шукала адзіноты. Я ясна сказала — мы прымаем тут усіх".

links.title: You: ""When was this?""
links.english: "When was this?"
links.polish: „Kiedy to było?”
links.belarusian: "Калі гэта было?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""She came last Friday. Left on Mond..."
links.english: "She came last Friday. Left on Monday, in a hurry..." Her wrinkled hand kneads a blue rag in the water. "What has she gotten herself into, that girl?"
links.polish: „Pojawiła się w zeszły piątek. Odeszła w poniedziałek, w pośpiechu...” – jej pomarszczone dłonie ugniatają w wodzie niebieską szmatę. „W co się wplątała?”
links.belarusian: "Яна прыйшла ў мінулую пятніцу. Пайшла ў панядзелак, паспешліва... — яе маршчыністыя рукі мнуць у вадзе блакітную анучку. — У што яна ўлезла?"

links.title: Empathy: "She seems genuinely worried about h..."
links.english: She seems genuinely worried about her previous tenant. She's seen her hiding out from trouble before, but this seems different.
links.polish: Wydaje się być szczerze zmartwiona o swoją poprzednią lokatorkę. Ukrywała ją już wcześniej przed kłopotami, ale to wydaje się być jednak czym innym.
links.belarusian: Яна выглядае шчыра занепакоенай праз сваю папярэднюю кватарантку. Яна ўжо бачыла, як тая хавалася ад праблем, але гэта, здаецца, нешта іншае.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's for the police to find out...."
links.english: "That's for the police to find out." The lieutenant takes out his familiar blue notebook. "Right then, please answer each question to the best of your ability. I'm sure we have a few."
links.polish: „Ustalenie tego to zadanie policji” – porucznik wyjmuje swój niebieski notatnik. „Proszę odpowiedzieć na każde pytanie najlepiej, jak pani potrafi. Na pewno mamy ich kilka”.
links.belarusian: "Паліцыя мусіць гэта высветліць, — лейтэнант вымае свой знаёмы сіні нататнік. — Цяпер, калі ласка, адкажыце на кожнае пытанне як мага лепш. У нас дакладна іх некалькі".

links.title: You: ""I had a few more questions about R..."
links.english: "I had a few more questions about Ruby..."
links.polish: „Mam jeszcze kilka pytań o Ruby...”
links.belarusian: "У мяне была яшчэ пара пытанняў пра Рубі..."

links.title: Washerwoman: ""What more do you want to know abou..."
links.english: "What more do you want to know about that poor girl?"
links.polish: „Co jeszcze chce pan wiedzieć o tej biednej dziewczynie?”
links.belarusian: "Што яшчэ вы хочаце ведаць пра гэтую бедную дзяўчыну?"

links.title: You: ""You said she left on Monday?""
links.english: "You said she left on Monday?"
links.polish: „Mówiła pani, że wyruszyła w poniedziałek?”
links.belarusian: "Вы казалі, яна пайшла ў панядзелак?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Yes, early, with the dogs -- aroun..."
links.english: "Yes, early, with the dogs -- around 8 o'clock, I think."
links.polish: „Tak, wcześnie, skoro świt – zdaje się, że około 8 rano”.
links.belarusian: "Так, рана, на досвітку —  каля 8 раніцы, мяркую".

links.title: Logic: "She probably heard the lieutenant's..."
links.english: She probably heard the lieutenant's Kineema drive by and it woke her up, just like it did you.
links.polish: Pewnie obudził ją hałas kineemy przejeżdżającego tu porucznika, tak jak później ciebie.
links.belarusian: Яна напэўна пачула, як праязджала кініма лейтэнанта, і гэта абудзіла яе, дакладна як і цябе.

links.title: You: ""Kim, she must have heard your Kine..."
links.english: "Kim, she must have heard your Kineema."
links.polish: „Kim, musiała usłyszeć twoją kineemę”.
links.belarusian: "Кім, яна мусіла пачуць тваю кініму".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes. That is a downside of having..."
links.english: "Yes. That is a downside of having a 130 kilowatt engine." His voice is tinged with pride. "It lets the bad guys know when you're coming."
links.polish: „Tak. To wada 130-kilowatowego silnika” – odpiera z dumą w głosie. „Przestępcy wiedzą, że nadjeżdżasz”.
links.belarusian: "Так. Гэта недахоп рухавіка магутнасцю 130 кілават, — у ягоным голасе гучыць гонар. — Злачынцы ведаюць, калі ты набліжаешся".

links.title: Logic: "She probably heard the lieutenant's..."
links.english: She probably heard the lieutenant's Kineema drive by.
links.polish: Pewnie słyszała przejeżdżającego w swojej kineemie porucznika.
links.belarusian: Яна напэўна пачула, як праязджала кініма лейтэнанта.

links.title: You: ""Is the room exactly as she left it?""
links.english: "Is the room exactly as she left it?"
links.polish: „Pokój jest dokładnie w takim stanie, w jakim go zostawiła?”
links.belarusian: "Пакой дакладна ў такім стане, у якім яна яго пакінула?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""I cleaned it, like I always do.""
links.english: "I cleaned it, like I always do."
links.polish: „Posprzątałam w nim tak jak zawsze”.
links.belarusian: "Я прыбрала ў ім, як заўсёды".

links.title: You: ""Was there anything else there?""
links.english: "Was there anything else there?"
links.polish: „Było w nim coś jeszcze?”
links.belarusian: "Было там нешта яшчэ?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""No.""
links.english: "No."
links.polish: „Nie”.
links.belarusian: "Не".

links.title: Drama: "The truth, sire."
links.english: The truth, sire.
links.polish: To prawda, szanowny panie.
links.belarusian: Праўда, васпане.

links.title: You: ""What is she like, Ruby?""
links.english: "What is she like, Ruby?"
links.polish: „Ruby. Jaka ona jest?”
links.belarusian: "Якая яна, Рубі?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""She's good company. Knows how to t..."
links.english: "She's good company. Knows how to talk to an old woman." She rubs her cold hands together. "At my age, you don't get a lot of quality conversation, so I really appreciate that about her."
links.polish: „Świetna z niej towarzyszka. Potrafi rozmawiać ze starymi kobietami” – zaciera ręce. „W moim wieku człowiek nie ma zbyt wielu okazji do ciekawych rozmów, więc naprawdę to w niej doceniam”.
links.belarusian: "З яе добрая кампанія. Ведае, як размаўляць са старой жанчынай, — яна пацірае змерзлыя рукі. — У маім узросце бракуе якасных размоў, таму я сапраўды гэта ў ёй цаню".

links.title: Suggestion: "This Ruby is an old-lady whisperer...."
links.english: This Ruby is an old-lady whisperer. She knows how to work the village elder -- unlike you.
links.polish: Ruby to zaklinaczka kobiet w sile wieku. Wie, jak podejść starszą wioski. Ty nie wiesz.
links.belarusian: Гэтая Рубі — заклінальніца старых кабет. Яна ведае, што рабіць з вясковымі старэйшынамі — у адрозненне ад цябе.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Did she talk to you much during he..."
links.english: "Did she talk to you much during her last stay?"
links.polish: „Czy podczas ostatniego pobytu wiele z panią rozmawiała?”
links.belarusian: "Ці шмат яна з вамі размаўляла падчас апошняга побыту?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""No, she was mostly silent this tim..."
links.english: "No, she was mostly silent this time. Kept to herself..."
links.polish: „Nie, tym razem nie była rozmowna. Unikała towarzystwa...”
links.belarusian: "Не, гэтым разам яна была збольшага маўклівая. Нетаварыская..."

links.title: You: ""What do you mean?""
links.english: "What do you mean?"
links.polish: „Co ma pani na myśli?”
links.belarusian: "Што вы маеце на ўвазе?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""She tried not to let it show, but..."
links.english: "She tried not to let it show, but I could tell she hadn't come to fish -- usually she likes to cast a few lines, but this time she mostly stayed in her room."
links.polish: „Starała się tego nie okazywać, ale poznałam, że nie pojawiła się, aby łowić ryby – zwykle zarzucała kilka wędek, ale tym razem większość czasu spędzała w swoim pokoju”.
links.belarusian: "Яна старалася гэтага не паказваць, але я зразумела, што яна прыйшла не дзеля рыбалкі — звычайна яна любіць закінуць пару вудаў, але гэтым разам збольшага заставалася ў сваім пакоі".

links.title: Suggestion: "She wanted to talk to her, as they..."
links.english: She wanted to talk to her, as they usually do. But she was brooding.
links.polish: Chciała z nią porozmawiać, jak to robiły zazwyczaj. Ona jednak była ponura.
links.belarusian: Яна хацела з ёй пагаварыць, як звычайна. Але яна была занепакоеная.

links.title: You: ""Did she talk to you much this time?""
links.english: "Did she talk to you much this time?"
links.polish: „Tym razem dużo z panią rozmawiała?”
links.belarusian: "Ці шмат яна з вамі размаўляла гэтым разам?"

links.title: You: ""Why do you think she left the bull..."
links.english: "Why do you think she left the bullet there?"
links.polish: „Dlaczego pani zdaniem zostawiła tu ten nabój?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму, на вашу думку, яна пакінула тут гэты патрон?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""How would I know? She's a gruff on..."
links.english: "How would I know? She's a gruff one, but not violent. She doesn't go around toting a gun." She looks back toward her shack, thinking.
links.polish: „Skąd mam wiedzieć? Była gburowata, ale nie agresywna. Nie chodziła z pistoletem przy pasie” – spogląda w zamyśleniu na swój dom.
links.belarusian: "Адкуль мне ведаць? Яна грубая, але не агрэсіўная. Не ходзіць з пісталетам пры поясе", — яна задуменна азіраецца на сваю хаціну.

links.title: Inland Empire: "You could ask her about your hunch...."
links.english: You could ask her about your hunch. That it was a *desperate* measure. See if she thinks Ruby fits the bill.
links.polish: Mógłbyś powiedzieć jej o swoim przeczuciu. Że to był *desperacki* środek. Sprawdzić, czy jej zdaniem Ruby mogłaby to zrobić.
links.belarusian: Ты мог бы спытаць яе пра сваё падазрэнне. Што гэта была *адчайная* мера. Паглядзець, ці лічыць яна Рубі здатнай на гэта.

links.title: You: ""I have a possible explanation in m..."
links.english: "I have a possible explanation in my mind."
links.polish: „Znam chyba możliwe wyjaśnienie”.
links.belarusian: "У мяне ёсць імавернае тлумачэнне".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Aye? Do tell." A seagull flies ove..."
links.english: "Aye? Do tell." A seagull flies overhead -- obviously a bad omen.
links.polish: „Tak? Niech pan powie” – nad wami przelatuje mewa – to zły omen.
links.belarusian: "Аёй? Скажыце ж", — кірля пралятае над галавой — відавочна дрэннае прадвесце.

links.title: You: ""It's an exit plan.""
links.english: "It's an exit plan."
links.polish: „To wyjście awaryjne”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта аварыйны выхад".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Exit from what?""
links.english: "Exit from what?"
links.polish: „Wyjście? Skąd?”
links.belarusian: "Выхад адкуль?"

links.title: You: ""Her life.""
links.english: "Her life."
links.polish: „Z jej życia”.
links.belarusian: "З яе жыцця".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant stops writing for a..."
links.english: The lieutenant stops writing for a moment. He looks at you, then at the old woman.
links.polish: Porucznik przerywa na chwilę pisanie. Spogląda na ciebie, a potem na staruszkę.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант на імгненне перастае пісаць. Ён глядзіць на цябе, а потым на старую.

links.title: Washerwoman: ""No..." She tilts her head to the s..."
links.english: "No..." She tilts her head to the side, looking up at you, deep in thought. "She's a fighter."
links.polish: „Nie...” – przekrzywia głowę, spoglądając na ciebie w głębokim zamyśleniu. „Ona jest wojowniczką”.
links.belarusian: "Не... — яна нахіляе галаву набок, гледзячы на цябе, глыбока ў думках. — Яна змагарка".

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Not a quitter. Like you sometimes g..."
links.english: Not a quitter. Like you sometimes get, son.
links.polish: Nie uciekinierką. Nie to co czasem ty, synku.
links.belarusian: Не ўцякачка. Не такая, як ты часам, сынку.

links.title: Drama: "She really believes that."
links.english: She really believes that.
links.polish: Naprawdę w to wierzy.
links.belarusian: Яна сапраўды ў гэта верыць.

links.title: You: ""The world.""
links.english: "The world."
links.polish: „Ze świata”.
links.belarusian: "Са свету".

links.title: You: ""This..." (Spread your hands.)"
links.english: "This..." (Spread your hands.)
links.polish: „Z tego...” (Rozłóż ręce).
links.belarusian: "З гэтага..." (Развесці рукі.)

links.title: You: ""On second thought, I'd rather not..."
links.english: "On second thought, I'd rather not say. It's not something I want to think about."
links.polish: „Z drugiej strony, wolałbym nie mówić. Nie jest to coś, o czym chciałbym myśleć”.
links.belarusian: "З другога боку, я б лепш не казаў. Гэта не тое, пра што я хачу думаць".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""That bad, is it?""
links.english: "That bad, is it?"
links.polish: „To aż tak złe?”
links.belarusian: "Настолькі дрэнна, так?"

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "Your hand twitches. A single bullet..."
links.english: Your hand twitches. A single bullet hidden from sight. Remember the way it slides into the barrel. The muzzle of the loaded weapon pointed at your heart -- it feels familiar, doesn't it?
links.polish: Ręka ci drga. Pojedynczy, ukryty nabój. Przypomnij sobie sposób, w jaki wsuwa się do lufy. Załadowana, wycelowana w twoje serce broń. Jakby znajome uczucie, prawda?
links.belarusian: Твая рука дрыжыць. Адзінкавы, схаваны патрон. Успомні, як ён слізгае ў ствол. Дула зараджанай зброі, скіраванае ў твае сэрца — адчуваецца знаёма, ці не так?

links.title: Half Light: "She planned on fuckin' shooting her..."
links.english: She planned on fuckin' shooting herself in the goddamned head.
links.polish: Kurwa, planowała, strzelić sobie w cholerny łeb.
links.belarusian: Халера, яна планавала пусціць сраную кулю сабе ў галаву.

links.title: You: ""I heard she was a heavy drinker wi..."
links.english: "I heard she was a heavy drinker with anger issues. You ever witness that kind of behaviour?"
links.polish: „Słyszałem, że dużo pije i ma problemy z powściąganiem gniewu. Miała pani do czynienia z takimi jej zachowaniami?”
links.belarusian: "Я чуў, што яна шмат п’е і мае праблемы з гневам. Вы калі-небудзь сутыкаліся з такімі яе паводзінамі?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Nothing of the sort." She shakes h..."
links.english: "Nothing of the sort." She shakes her head. "Sure, she was no stranger to the bottle... she fit in, that way. But I only knew her to have a beer on the beach while watching the sunset..."
links.polish: „Nic z tych rzeczy” – kręci głową. „Oczywiście nieobca jej była butelka... Dzięki temu tu pasowała. Ale ja widziałam tylko, jak pije piwo na plaży, patrząc na zachód słońca...”
links.belarusian: "Нічога з гэтых рэчаў" – трасе галавой. "Вядома, ёй ня чужая была бутэлька... Дзякуючы гэтаму яна тут пасавала. Але я бачыла толькі, як яна п’е піва на пляжы, гледзячы на захад сонца..."

links.title: Inland Empire: "The sun sets for everyone."
links.english: The sun sets for everyone.
links.polish: Słońce zachodzi dla każdego.
links.belarusian: Сонца заходзіць для кожнага.

links.title: Washerwoman: ""She isn't what you'd call a *drunk..."
links.english: "She isn't what you'd call a *drunk*. Even offered me some, from time to time. Said it was part of the camionneur life. But I never saw her lose control of herself, the way some people do."
links.polish: „Nie jest kimś, kogo można nazwać *pijakiem*. Czasem mnie nawet częstowała. Mówiła, że to część życia camionneura. Ale nigdy nie widziałam, żeby straciła nad sobą kontrolę, tak jak zdarza się to niektórym”.
links.belarusian: "Яна не та, каго можна назваць *п'яніцам*. Часам яна нават частавала мяне. Казала, што гэта частка жыцця вадзіцеля грузавіка. Але я ніколі не бачыла, каб яна страціла над сабой кантроль, як тое здараецца з некаторымі".

links.title: You: ""Did she have any technical equipme..."
links.english: "Did she have any technical equipment with her, like radio stuff?"
links.polish: „Miała ze sobą jakiś techniczny sprzęt? Radio albo coś podobnego?”
links.belarusian: "Ці мела яна з сабой якія-небудзь тэхнічныя прылады, накшталт радыё?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Not that I know of, though she was..."
links.english: "Not that I know of, though she was into nice music. She once showed me a few mixtape-milieus she'd made." She brushes her forehead with the back of her hand. Water drips to the ground.
links.polish: „Nic mi o tym nie wiadomo, ale lubiła ładną muzykę. Raz pokazała mi taśmę z różnymi milieu, którą nagrała” – ociera czoło grzbietem dłoni. Woda skapuje na ziemię.
links.belarusian: "Нічога мне пра гэта не вядома, але яна любіла прыгожую музыку. Аднаго разу паказала мне стужку з рознымі асяроддзямі, якую яна запісала," – выцірае лоб тыльным бокам рукі. Вада капае на зямлю.

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Although I guess she was pretty ha..."
links.english: "Although I guess she was pretty handy with the mechanical and technical stuff. Even fixed the heater in the shack. You should be thankful for that."
links.polish: „Chyba znała się na tych mechanicznych i technicznych sprawach. Naprawiła nawet piecyk w chacie. Powinien być jej pan wdzięczny”.
links.belarusian: "Пэўна, яна разбіралася ў гэтых механічных і тэхнічных справах. Яна нават адрамантавала пячку ў хаце. Вы павінны быць ёй удзячны".

links.title: Savoir Faire: "She may simply have kept the equipm..."
links.english: She may simply have kept the equipment elsewhere.
links.polish: Mogła po prostu trzymać sprzęt gdzie indziej.
links.belarusian: Яна магла проста трымаць абсталяванне ў іншым месцы.

links.title: You: ""Where did she go?" (Move on.)"
links.english: "Where did she go?" (Move on.)
links.polish: „Gdzie teraz jest?” (Przejdź dalej).
links.belarusian: "Куды яна пайшла?" (Рушыць далей.)

links.title: Washerwoman: ""I don't know... further up the coa..."
links.english: "I don't know... further up the coast. She tried to leave quietly but the hinges on that door screech like a cat in heat -- woke me up. I heard her rushing in those heavy boots, heading up north."
links.polish: „Nie wiem... Gdzieś dalej na wybrzeżu. Próbowała wymknąć się po cichu, ale zawiasy tych drzwi hałasują jak koty na wiosnę – obudziły mnie. Słyszałam, jak biegnie w tych swoich ciężkich butach na północ”.
links.belarusian: "Не ведаю... Далей па ўзбярэжжы. Яна спрабавала выйсці крадком, але завесы на гэтых дзвярах рыпяць, як мартаўскія каты — абудзілі мяне. Я чула, як яна бяжыць у тых цяжкіх ботах, кіруючыся на поўнач".

links.title: Visual Calculus: "It's a peninsula. She might be *tra..."
links.english: It's a peninsula. She might be *trapped*.
links.polish: To półwysep. Może być *uwięziona*.
links.belarusian: Гэта паўвыспа. Яна можа быць *у пастцы*.

links.title: Washerwoman: ""You'll never find her, you know."..."
links.english: "You'll never find her, you know." Her tone is without malice. "She knows the coast like the back of her hand. *You* only just arrived."
links.polish: „Nigdy jej pan nie znajdzie” – stwierdza głosem pozbawionym złośliwości. „Ona zna wybrzeże jak własną kieszeń. *Pan* dopiero się na nim pojawił”.
links.belarusian: "Вы ніколі яе не знойдзеце, ведаеце, — у яе тоне няма зласлівасці. — Яна ведае ўзбярэжжа як свае пяць пальцаў. *Вы* жа толькі што прыбылі".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I wouldn't worry about that, ma'am..."
links.english: "I wouldn't worry about that, ma'am. We're persistent."
links.polish: „Niech się pani nie martwi. Jesteśmy wytrwali”.
links.belarusian: "Я б не турбаваўся пра гэта, спадарыня. Мы настойлівыя".

links.english: This is a cool moment. It needs a cool thing to be said.
links.polish: To czadowy moment. Trzeba powiedzieć coś czadowego.
links.belarusian: Гэта круты момант. Трэба сказаць нешта крутое.

links.english: (Say the cool thing.) "Let's rock with our cock."
links.polish: (Powiedz coś czadowego). „No to jedziemy na kurwy”.
links.belarusian: (Сказаць штосьці крутое.) "Ну што ж, паехалі на курвi".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I wouldn't worry about that, ma'am..."
links.english: "What?"
links.polish: „Co?”
links.belarusian: "Што?"

links.title: You: ""Further up the coast we go then.""
links.english: "I meant: let's rock with our cock out."
links.polish: „Chciałem powiedzieć: no to jedziemy na pełne kurwy”.
links.belarusian: "Я хацеў сказаць: ну дык паехалі на поўнай хуткасці".

links.title: You: ""Further up the coast we go then.""
links.english: "You're still not saying it right."
links.polish: „Wciąż nie mówisz tego, jak trzeba”.
links.belarusian: "Ты ўсё яшчэ гаворыш гэта не так, як трэба".

links.title: You: ""Further up the coast we go then.""
links.english: "Okay -- let's rock with our cock*s* out!"
links.polish: „Dobra: no to jedziemy na pełnej kurwie!”
links.belarusian: "Добра: дык рушым на поўнай хуткасці!"

links.title: You: ""Further up the coast we go then.""
links.english: "It's too late now."
links.polish: „Teraz jest już za późno”.
links.belarusian: "Зараз ужо занадта позна".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""She isn't what you'd call a *drunk..."
links.english: The old woman shakes her head slowly.
links.polish: Kobieta powoli kręci głową.
links.belarusian: Жанчына павольна круціць галавой.

links.title: You: ""Further up the coast we go then.""
links.english: "What?"
links.polish: „Co?”
links.belarusian: "Што?"

links.title: You: ""Further up the coast we go then.""
links.english: "What did you say." The lieutenant gives you a puzzled look.
links.polish: „Co powiedziałeś?” – porucznik rzuca ci zdziwione spojrzenie.
links.belarusian: "Што ты сказаў?" — лейтэнант кідае на цябе здзіўлены позірк.

links.title: You: ""Further up the coast we go then.""
links.english: "Nothing. What did you say?"
links.polish: „Nic. A ty co powiedziałeś?”
links.belarusian: "Нічога. А ты што сказаў?"

links.title: You: ""Further up the coast we go then.""
links.english: "Nevermind," he says, shaking his head. "Let's just continue."
links.polish: „Nieważne” – odpowiada, kręcąc głową. „Przejdźmy po prostu dalej”.
links.belarusian: "Не важна" — адказвае, круцячы галавой. "Проста пяройдзем далей".

links.title: You: ""Further up the coast we go then.""
links.english: "Further up the coast we go then."
links.polish: „No, to ruszamy dalej wzdłuż brzegu”.
links.belarusian: "Ну, паехалі далей уздоўж берага".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Are you sure you wouldn't rather s..."
links.english: "Are you sure you wouldn't rather stay here, get a nice, cozy fire going in the heater?" She drops the rag into the bucket -- it's clean now. "Seems like a better idea to me..."
links.polish: „Na pewno nie wolałby pan zostać tutaj, usiąść przy ciepłym ogniu rozpalonym w piecyku?” – pyta, upuszczając do wiadra szmatę, która jest teraz czysta. „Mam wrażenie, że to lepszy pomysł...”
links.belarusian: "Напэўна, вы б не хацелі застацца тут, прысесці каля цёплага агню, распаленага ў печы?" – пытае, кідаючы ў вядро анучу, якая зараз чыстая. "Мне здаецца, што гэта лепшая ідэя..."

links.title: Inland Empire: "The 'Feld Electric' mural... you fe..."
links.english: The 'Feld Electric' mural... you feel like you should go look at it again. Step *closer* this time.
links.polish: Mural Feld Electric... Czujesz, że powinieneś znowu iść na niego popatrzeć. Tym razem podejść *bliżej*.
links.belarusian: Фрэска Feld Electric... Ты адчуваеш, што павінен зноў пайсці паглядзець на яе. Гэтым разам падойдзь *бліжэй*.

links.title: Endurance: "No. You can do it. You still have p..."
links.english: No. You can do it. You still have plenty of juice in you before you drop.
links.polish: Nie. Dasz radę. Wciąż masz jeszcze masę energii do wykorzystania.
links.belarusian: Не. Ты здолееш. У цябе яшчэ шмат энергіі для выкарыстання.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Behind the cinderblock houses, old..."
links.english: Behind the cinderblock houses, old pre-war ruins rise to the sky like dark palaces. The wind calls.
links.polish: Za domami z pustaków w niebo wzbijają się niczym mroczne pałace przedwojenne ruiny. Słyszysz zew wichru.
links.belarusian: За дамамі з пустакоў у неба ўзнімаюцца, нібыта змрочныя палацы, перадваенныя руіны. Ты чуеш заклік ветру.

links.title: You: ""You're right, this place is huge...."
links.english: "You're right, this place is huge. She's a needle in a haystack."
links.polish: „Racja, to ogromny teren. Jest jak igła w stogu siana”.
links.belarusian: "Сапраўды, гэта велізарная тэрыторыя. Гэта як іголка ў стозе сена".

Alternate1.english: "But that place is huge. She's a needle in a haystack."
Alternate1.polish: „Ale to ogromny teren. Jest jak igła w stogu siana”.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Але гэта велізарная тэрыторыя. Гэта як іголка ў стогу сена".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Yes, it's going to be too much wor..."
links.english: "Yes, it's going to be too much work for you to find her." She drops the rag into the bucket -- it's clean now. "Better for you to stay here, get a nice, cosy fire going in the heater..."
links.polish: „Tak, odnalezienie jej wymagałoby zbyt wiele pracy” – stwierdza, upuszczając do wiadra szmatę, która jest teraz czysta. „Lepiej niech pan tu zostanie, rozpali ciepły ogień w piecyku...”
links.belarusian: "Так, адшукаць яе запатрабавала б занадта многа працы", — адзначае, кідаючы ў вядро анучу, якая цяпер чыстая. "Лепш застаньцеся тут, распаліце цёплы агонь у печы..."

links.title: You: "(Wipe your brow.) "Man, I was reall..."
links.english: (Wipe your brow.) "Man, I was really hoping she'd be hiding in this village."
links.polish: (Otrzyj czoło). „Rany, serio miałem nadzieję, że będzie się ukrywać w tej wiosce”.
links.belarusian: (Выцер лоб). "Ой, сур'ёзна спадзяваўся, што ён будзе хавацца ў гэтай вёсцы".

links.title: You: ""Are you sure she didn't go somewhe..."
links.english: "Are you sure she didn't go somewhere more pleasant... and less wet?"
links.polish: „Na pewno nie udała się w jakieś przyjemniejsze... i mniej mokre miejsce?”
links.belarusian: "Напэўна, яна не накіравалася ў якое-небудзь прыемнейшае... і менш мокрае месца?"

links.title: You: ""Enough about Ruby, I had other que..."
links.english: "Enough about Ruby, I had other questions..."
links.polish: „Dość już o Ruby, mam inne pytania...”
links.belarusian: "Досыць пра Рубі, у мяне былі іншыя пытанні..."

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Yes, let's hear those other questi..."
links.english: "Yes, let's hear those other questions." She looks around as spring snow starts falling -- lightly on the fishing village.
links.polish: „Tak, posłuchajmy tych pytań” – rozgląda się wokół. Na rybacką wieś zaczyna opadać wolno wiosenny śnieg.
links.belarusian: "Так, давайце паслухаем гэтыя іншыя пытанні", — яна азіраецца, а на рыбацкую вёску пачынае павольна падаць веснавы снег.

links.title: You: ""Have you seen a woman named Ruby a..."
links.english: "Have you seen a woman named Ruby around here?"
links.polish: „Widziała tu pani może kobietę imieniem Ruby?”
links.belarusian: "Вы ня бачылі тут жанчыну па імені Рубі?"

Alternate1.english: "Have you seen a red-haired woman named Ruby around the coast?"
Alternate1.polish: „Widziała może pani na wybrzeżu rudowłosą kobietę imieniem Ruby?”
Alternate1.belarusian: "Ці не бачыла вы, выпадкова, на ўзбярэжжы жанчыну з рудымі валасамі па імені Рубі?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Nay, I haven't *seen* anyone latel..."
links.english: "Nay, I haven't *seen* anyone lately."
links.polish: „Nie, nie *widziałam* ostatnio nikogo”.
links.belarusian: "Не, я апошнім часам нікога *не бачыла*".

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Because she's blind, which you seem..."
links.english: Because she's blind, which you seem to have forgotten.
links.polish: Bo jest niewidoma, o czym najwyraźniej zapomniałeś.
links.belarusian: Бо яна невідушчая, пра што ты, відаць, забыў.

links.title: You: ""Oh, because you're blind, right.""
links.english: "Oh, because you're blind, right."
links.polish: „Och, bo jest pani niewidoma, racja”.
links.belarusian: "Ах, бо вы невідушчы, праўда".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""He's a sharp one," she says to her..."
links.english: "He's a sharp one," she says to herself and runs her hand across the washboard.
links.polish: „Jaki bystry” – mówi sama do siebie i przesuwa dłonią po tarze do prania.
links.belarusian: "Які кемлівы" — кажа сама сабе і праводзіць рукой па дошцы для мыцця.

links.title: Rhetoric: "She's being evasive. She knows some..."
links.english: She's being evasive. She knows something.
links.polish: Unika odpowiedzi. Coś wie.
links.belarusian: Пазбягайце адказу. Нешта ведае.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There was a murder in Martinaise."..."
links.english: "There was a murder in Martinaise." He points east. "She might be a suspect. We would appreciate your help."
links.polish: „W Martinaise popełniono morderstwo” – wskazuje na wschód. „Ona może być podejrzaną w tej sprawie. Będziemy wdzięczni za pomoc”.
links.belarusian: "У Марцінэзе здзейснена забойства", – паказвае на ўсход. "Яна можа быць падазраванай у гэтай справе. Будзем удзячныя за дапамогу".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Would you now?" She turns to him...."
links.english: "Would you now?" She turns to him. "I know how this world works, and it doesn't work when people tell on each other."
links.polish: „Czyżby?” – pyta, spoglądając na niego. „Wiem, jak działa ten świat, i mogę pana zapewnić, że nie działa, gdy ludzie na siebie donoszą”.
links.belarusian: "Ці праўда?" — пытаецца, зірнуўшы на яго. "Я ведаю, як працуе гэты свет, і магу вас запэўніць, што ён не працуе, калі людзі даносяць адзін на аднаго".

links.title: You: ""You know something. We're here to..."
links.english: "You know something. We're here to help."
links.polish: „Coś pani wie. Przybyliśmy tutaj, żeby pomóc”.
links.belarusian: "Нешта вы ведаеце. Мы прыехалі сюды, каб дапамагчы".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Aye, that you are, dark Omen -- he..."
links.english: "Aye, that you are, dark Omen -- help yourselves and your organization. Help the storm clouds gather on the horizon..." She shakes her head.
links.polish: „Tak, to prawda, mroczny omenie – pomóc sobie i swojej organizacji. Pomóc burzowym chmurom zbierającym się na horyzoncie...” – stwierdza, kręcąc głową.
links.belarusian: "Так, гэта праўда, змрочны амене — дапамагчы сабе і сваёй арганізацыі. Дапамагчы навальнічным хмарам, якія збіраюцца на гарызонце..." — сцвярджае ён, круцячы галавой.

links.title: Half Light: "Enough of this! She better start ta..."
links.english: Enough of this! She better start talking RIGHT NOW!
links.polish: Dość tego! Lepiej niech zacznie mówić, I TO JUŻ!
links.belarusian: Хопіць гэтага! Няхай пачне гаварыць, І ГЭТА ЎЖО!

links.title: You: ""God dammit, I know you know someth..."
links.english: "God dammit, I know you know something. This shit is important!"
links.polish: „Jasna cholera, wiem, że pani coś wie! To gówno jest ważne!”
links.belarusian: "Чыстая халера, ведаю, што вы нешта ведаеце! Гэта дзярмо важнае!"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""'This *shit*?" Her eyes with their..."
links.english: "'This *shit*?" Her eyes with their cataracts look at you. "I'm not going to do your work for you, just because you've got a potty mouth."
links.polish: „»To *gówno*«?” – pyta, spoglądając na ciebie swoimi pokrytymi bielmem oczami. „Nie zamierzam wykonywać za pana pańskiej roboty tylko dlatego, że ma pan niewyparzoną gębę”.
links.belarusian: ""То *г..но*?" – пытаецца, гледзячы на ​​цябе сваімі закрытымі бельмом вачыма. "Я не збіраюся выконваць за вас вашу працу толькі таму, што вы маеце неахайныя вусны".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I see, ma'am." The lieutenant turn..."
links.english: "I see, ma'am." The lieutenant turns to you. "I hope you don't mind if we look around anyway."
links.polish: „Rozumiem, proszę pani”. Porucznik odwraca się do ciebie: „Mam nadzieję, że nie ma pani nic przeciwko, jeśli i tak się rozejrzymy”.
links.belarusian: "Разумею, спадарыня". Лейтэнант звяртаецца да цябе: "Спадзяюся, вы не супраць, калі мы ўсё ж такі агледзімся".

links.title: Logic: "You should look around your shack -..."
links.english: You should look around your shack -- maybe she's rented it out to others too?
links.polish: Powinieneś rozejrzeć się po swojej chacie. Może wynajmowała ją też innym?
links.belarusian: Ты павінен агледзецца па сваёй хаце. Магчыма, яна таксама здавала яе іншым?

links.title: Logic: "Ruby was here. You know it."
links.english: Ruby was here. You know it.
links.polish: Ruby tu była. Wiesz to.
links.belarusian: Рубі тут была. Ты гэта ведаеш.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "You need to look into these shacks...."
links.english: You need to look into these shacks. Especially hers.
links.polish: Musisz przyjrzeć się tym chatom. Szczególnie tej, która należy do niej.
links.belarusian: Вы павінны ўважліва разгледзець гэтыя чаты. Асабліва той, які належыць ёй.

links.title: Suggestion: "Ask her about lodgings..."
links.english: Ask her about lodgings...
links.polish: Spytaj ją o kwaterę...
links.belarusian: Спытай яе пра кватэру...

links.title: You: ""'I see. You know something, but yo..."
links.english: "'I see. You know something, but you've decided not to tell us."
links.polish: „Rozumiem. Coś pani wie, ale postanowiła nam pani tego nie mówić”.
links.belarusian: "Я разумею. Штосьці вы ведаеце, але вырашыце нам гэтага не казаць".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""There's not much *to* tell. People..."
links.english: "There's not much *to* tell. People come and go. Now, was there something else?"
links.polish: „Nie ma wiele *do* powiedzenia. Ludzie przychodzą i odchodzą. Ma pan jeszcze jakieś pytania?”
links.belarusian: "Няма многага, што можна было б сказаць. Людзі прыходзяць і адыходзяць. У вас ёсць яшчэ нейкія пытанні?"

links.title: You: ""Okay, but I'll be back later if I..."
links.english: "Okay, but I'll be back later if I find anything *suspicious*."
links.polish: „Dobrze, ale wrócę później, jeśli znajdę coś *podejrzanego*”.
links.belarusian: "Добра, але вернуся пазней, калі знайду нешта *падазронае*".

Alternate1.english: "Okay, but we'll be back later if we find anything *suspicious*."
Alternate1.polish: „Dobrze, ale wrócimy później, jeśli znajdziemy coś *podejrzanego*”.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Добра, але вернемся пазней, калі знойдзем што-небудзь *падазронае*".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""I'm not going anywhere." Her featu..."
links.english: "I'm not going anywhere." Her features soften. "Perhaps there's something else the village can do for you, huh? Though we don't have much here -- just garbage. And a skiff or two..."
links.polish: „Nigdzie się stąd nie wybieram” – jej twarz łagodnieje. „Może nasza wieś może panu pomóc w jakiś inny sposób? Niewiele mamy – tylko śmieci. I jedną czy dwie łódki...”
links.belarusian: "Я адсюль нікуды не пайду" – яе твар робіцца мякчэйшым. "Можа, наша вёска можа дапамагчы вам нейкім іншым чынам? У нас няшмат – толькі смецце. І адна ці дзве лодкі..."

links.title: You: ""This is like when that man locked..."
links.english: "This is like when that man locked himself in the woodshed. We just need to help her come out."
links.polish: „To tak jak wtedy, kiedy jeden facet zatrzasnął się w szopie. Musimy po prostu pomóc jej wyjść z zamknięcia”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта як тады, калі адзін мужчына зачыніўся ў хлеве. Мы проста павінны дапамагчы ёй выйсці з замкнёнасці".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""No, it's *not* like that man. With..."
links.english: "No, it's *not* like that man. With him, we called you. Right now, you just arrived by yourself. Like a raven, plucking at the window glass."
links.polish: „Nie, to nie jest jak z tym mężczyzną. W jego przypadku was wezwaliśmy. Teraz pojawiliście się sami z siebie. Jak kruk stukający dziobem w szybę”.
links.belarusian: "Не, гэта не так, як з тым мужчынам. У ягоным выпадку мы вас паклікалі. Зараз вы з'явіліся самі па сабе. Як крук, які стукае дзюбай у шкло".

links.title: You: ""This isn't about the Union, you kn..."
links.english: "This isn't about the Union, you know. You don't have to worry about retaliation."
links.polish: „Tu nie chodzi o Związek, wie pani. Nie musi pani obawiać się zemsty”.
links.belarusian: "Справа не ў Звязе, ведаеце. Вам не трэба баяцца помсты".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Ah, I should have known..." She sh..."
links.english: "Ah, I should have known..." She shakes her head. "This is yet another Union mess. I'm not afraid of them, you know. We're not in the habit of being afraid around here."
links.polish: „Powinnam była się domyślić...” – kręci głową. „To kolejny bałagan Związku. Nie boję się ich. Nie mamy tu w zwyczaju bać się kogokolwiek”.
links.belarusian: "Я павінна была здагадацца..." — круціць галавой. "Гэта чарговы беспарадак Саюза. Я іх не баюся. У нас тут няма звычкі баяцца каго-ніхто".

links.title: You: ""Okay, but do you know who I'm talk..."
links.english: "Okay, but do you know who I'm talking about?"
links.polish: „Rozumiem. Ale wie pani, o kim mówię?”
links.belarusian: "Я ведаю. Але ці ведаеце вы, пра каго я кажу?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""This is my little cinderblock town..."
links.english: "This is my little cinderblock town." She nods with a wrinkled smile. "I know what goes on around here."
links.polish: „To moje miasteczko z pustaków” – kiwa głową z uśmiechem na pomarszczonej twarzy. „Wiem, co się w nim dzieje”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта мой гарадок з пустакоў", — ківае галавой з усмешкай на маршчыністым твары. "Я ведаю, што ў ім адбываецца".

links.title: You: ""Oh. Well, let me know if that chan..."
links.english: "Oh. Well, let me know if that changes. Let's talk about something else."
links.polish: „Och. No dobrze, proszę mi dać znać, jeśli to się zmieni. Porozmawiajmy o czym innym”.
links.belarusian: "О, добра. Калі ласка, дайце мне ведаць, калі гэта зменіцца. Давайце пагаворым пра што-небудзь іншае".

Alternate1.english: "Oh. Well, let us know if that changes. We're looking for a fugitive."
Alternate1.polish: „Och. No dobrze, proszę nam dać znać, jeśli to się zmieni. Poszukujemy podejrzanej”.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Ох. Ну добра, калі ласка, дайце нам ведаць, калі гэта зменіцца. Мы шукаем падазраваную".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Aye, officer. I certainly will.""
links.english: "Aye, officer. I certainly will."
links.polish: „Dobrze, panie władzo. Nie omieszkam”.
links.belarusian: "Добра, пане ўладару. Не прапушчу".

links.title: You: ""Actually, is that free room still..."
links.english: "Actually, is that free room still available?"
links.polish: „Ten darmowy pokój to wciąż jest dostępny?”
links.belarusian: "Ці гэты бясплатны пакой усё яшчэ даступны?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Change your mind, did you? I thoug..."
links.english: "Change your mind, did you? I thought you might. Won't find a better deal than free."
links.polish: „Zmienił pan zdanie? Wiedziałam, że tak będzie. Taniej niż za darmo się nie da”.
links.belarusian: "Вы змянілі сваё меркаванне? Я ведала, што так будзе. Танней, чым бясплатна, не бывае".

links.title: Washerwoman: ""Don't make this old women regret g..."
links.english: "Don't make this old women regret giving the police the key to her house." She takes out a key from under her apron and hands it to you. "Here."
links.polish: „Oby ta stara kobieta nie pożałowała przekazania policji klucza do swojego domu” – stwierdza, wręczając ci klucz wyjęty spod fartucha. „Proszę”.
links.belarusian: "Каб толькі гэтая старая жанчына не пашкадавала перадачы ключа ад сваёй хаты міліцыі", — выказвае яна, падаючы табе ключ, выняты з-пад фартуха. "Калі ласка".

links.title: You: ""Where could someone stay around he..."
links.english: "Where could someone stay around here?"
links.polish: „Gdzie mógłby się tutaj zatrzymać ktoś spoza wsi?”
links.belarusian: "Дзе мог бы тут спыніцца нехта з-за межаў вёскі?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""*Stay*? Most people here are tryin..."
links.english: "*Stay*? Most people here are trying to *leave*..."
links.polish: „*Zatrzymać się*? Większość stara się stąd *odejść*...”
links.belarusian: "*Спыніцца*? Большасць стараецца адсюль *сысці*..."

links.title: Washerwoman: ""That said, if lodgings is what you..."
links.english: "That said, if lodgings is what you're looking for, I've got a free room in the shack." Her soapy thumb points to the building behind her.
links.polish: „Ale jeśli szuka pan noclegu, to mam w mojej chacie wolny pokój” – stwierdza, wskazując umydlonym kciukiem budynek za sobą.
links.belarusian: "Але калі вы шукаеце начлег, то ў маёй хаце ёсць вольны пакой", — сцвярджае ён, паказваючы намыленым вялікім пальцам на будынак за сабой.

links.title: You: ""How much is it?""
links.english: "How much is it?"
links.polish: „Ile kosztuje wynajem?”
links.belarusian: "Колькі каштуе арэнда?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""I won't charge you for it. Take it..."
links.english: "I won't charge you for it. Take it as a gesture of goodwill, from the village to the RCM."
links.polish: „Nie wezmę pieniędzy. Niech to będzie gest dobrej woli naszej wsi wobec MOR-u”.
links.belarusian: "Не вазьму грошай. Няхай гэта будзе жэст добрай волі нашай вёскі ў дачыненні да РГМ".

links.title: You: ""Wait, hold on, you're just *giving..."
links.english: "Wait, hold on, you're just *giving* it to me?"
links.polish: „Zaraz, chwila, po prostu mi go pani *daje*?”
links.belarusian: "Зачакайте хвіліну, вы проста *даеце* яго мне?"

links.title: Washerwoman: ""No one is using it and god knows i..."
links.english: "No one is using it and god knows it's not much anyway." She tilts her head on the side, pondering over something. "You can stay there."
links.polish: „Nikt z niego nie korzysta i prawdę powiedziawszy, to nic specjalnego” – przechyla głowę na bok i nad czymś się zastanawia. „Może się pan w nim zatrzymać”.
